    <item> 
      <title>Dreaming brain rhythms lock in memories</title>  
      <description>Disrupting brain activity during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep can stop mice from forming new memories, a study suggests.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36275143#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36275143</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:05:46 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Solar Impulse plane reaches Oklahoma</title>  
      <description>Solar Impulse has landed in Tulsa, Oklahoma, ending stage 11 in its round-the-world journey.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36284496#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36284496</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:11:45 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Shrinking bird pays the bill for warming</title>  
      <description>A migratory bird has shrunk in stature as temperatures warm in its Arctic breeding ground, according to research.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36266692#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36266692</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:33:20 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/B424/production/_89661164_vangils1hr.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/DB34/production/_89661165_vangils1hr.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Satellite's ice vision is boosted</title>  
      <description>European scientists have found a way to super-charge their study of the Antarctic and Greenland ice sheets, enabling them to recover 100 times more detail in areas known to be melting.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36272728#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36272728</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:18:22 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Zika virus 'shrinks brains' in tests</title>  
      <description>Zika virus can enter the brains of mice in the womb to stunt development, the first animal tests show.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36248691#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36248691</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:00:22 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Dying coral reefs 'dull fish senses'</title>  
      <description>Fish are unable to learn the scent of their predators in dying coral reefs, research reveals.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36257701#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36257701</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 23:18:26 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/E079/production/_89656475_89656470.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/10789/production/_89656476_89656470.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Swarm tracks Earth's turbulent shield</title>  
      <description>Europe's Swarm space mission is providing an unprecedented view of Earth's protective magnetic field, scientists say.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36266258#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36266258</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 11:47:08 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/F876/production/_89660636_illus-1.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/11F86/production/_89660637_illus-1.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>'Oldest axe' made by early Australians</title>  
      <description>Archaeologists say a tiny stone flake from north-western Australia, nearly 50,000 years old, is a remnant of the earliest known axe with a handle.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36256733#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36256733</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 01:22:53 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>More than 100 Earth-sized planets found</title>  
      <description>Nasa announces the discovery of more than 100 Earth-sized planets orbiting alien stars.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36256725#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36256725</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 17:28:20 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/11F53/production/_89655537_89655533.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/14663/production/_89655538_89655533.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Trade routes written in camel DNA</title>  
      <description>Cross-continental study reveals how camels' genetic diversity is shaped by ancient trade routes.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36252141#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36252141</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 10:29:05 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/14E28/production/_89644558_89644550.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/17538/production/_89644559_89644550.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Rising seas swallow Pacific islands</title>  
      <description>Five Pacific islands have disappeared as a result of rising sea levels in a first confirmation of the impact of climate change on coastlines, scientists say.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36255749#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36255749</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 15:08:00 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Sentinel's first sea-surface height map</title>  
      <description>The EU's Sentinel-3a satellite offers a peek at what will be one of its most fundamental products - a map of sea surface height anomalies.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36255957#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36255957</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 10:39:46 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>New tally for total number of plants</title>  
      <description>A new report looking at the state of the world's plants estimates that 390,900 species are known to science.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36230858#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36230858</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 23:31:04 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/E04E/production/_89622475_dendrobiumcynthiaebystevebeckendorf.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/1075E/production/_89622476_dendrobiumcynthiaebystevebeckendorf.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Rover mission in 'last chance saloon'</title>  
      <description>Europe's rover mission to Mars is "drinking in the last chance saloon", warns the European Space Agency's director general, who says the project cannot have an open-ended schedule or budget.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36251642#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36251642</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 16:08:51 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Boaty McBoatface row 'good for science'</title>  
      <description>The Boaty McBoatface row has "put a smile on everyone's face" and been "good for science", the head of the National Environment Research Council tells MPs.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36260569#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36260569</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 06:20:15 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Crowds flock to car-free Champs Elysees</title>  
      <description>Thousands of people have take advantage of a move by the authorities in Paris to close the famous Champs Elysees thoroughfare to traffic.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36243119#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36243119</guid>  
      <pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 17:42:33 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Mercury completes journey across Sun</title>  
      <description>The Solar System's smallest planet has made one of its irregular passes between the Earth and Sun.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36228327#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36228327</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 18:44:00 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/C674/production/_89640805_89640797.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/ED84/production/_89640806_89640797.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Youthful 'second skin' to hide wrinkles</title>  
      <description>Scientists say they have developed an invisible elastic film that can be applied to the skin to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and eye bags.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36245728#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36245728</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 15:13:08 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Tributes paid to Attenborough at 90</title>  
      <description>Tributes are paid to renowned naturalist and broadcaster Sir David Attenborough as he turns 90.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36242216#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36242216</guid>  
      <pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 15:24:45 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Elephant has rotten molar extracted</title>  
      <description>An elephant at Whipsnade zoo has a rotten molar extracted after it stops eating and begins losing weight.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36273679#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36273679</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:51:52 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Trapped fox cub rescued from drain</title>  
      <description>A fox cub falls down a drain and the East Sussex Wildlife Rescue and Ambulance Service come to the rescue.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36270899#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36270899</guid>  
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 22:44:03 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Scientists: 21% of plants risk extinction</title>  
      <description>Scientists have published their first global assessment of the state of the world's plants.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36253638#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36253638</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 05:36:45 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Rare images of Mercury passing Sun</title>  
      <description>Nasa images capture Mercury transit the Sun, one of the few times it will do so this century.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36252487#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36252487</guid>  
      <pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 20:33:22 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: The deadly 'red tide' killing sea life</title>  
      <description>Chile's southern coast has been hit by the biggest ever "red tide" in history. It's caused by toxic algae which is killing sea life and damaging the local fishing economy.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-36261073#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-36261073</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 17:53:11 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Celebrating Attenborough at 90</title>  
      <description>A quick look at some of the best moments of the beloved broadcaster and naturalist.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36226923#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36226923</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 10:32:40 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/0DD5/production/_89614530_bbcrewindattenborough.png"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/34E5/production/_89614531_bbcrewindattenborough.png"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: 'Boaty' ship takes Attenborough's name</title>  
      <description>The UK's new state-of-the-art polar research ship will be named after Sir David Attenborough, despite the title "Boaty McBoatface" previously topping a public vote.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36229670#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36229670</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 14:37:56 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Solar Impulse lands safely in Arizona</title>  
      <description>Solar Impulse, a plane fuelled only by the sun, has landed in the US state of Arizona after a 16-hour flight from California.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36190073#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36190073</guid>  
      <pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2016 07:54:39 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Who is the 'Ivory Queen'?</title>  
      <description>The woman accused of leading one of Africa's biggest smuggling rings</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-36203798#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-36203798</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>The cave divers who went back for their friends</title>  
      <description>The cave divers who went back for their dead friends</description>

    <item> 
      <title>The hunt for natural antibacterials</title>  
      <description>Welsh scientists are on the hunt for alternative antibacterials</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-35886340#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

      <title>Abseiling into an Antarctic chasm</title>  
      <description>Visit the chasm threatening a British research base</description>

      <title>VIDEO: The world's worst nuclear disaster</title>  
      <description>The aftermath of the Chernobyl explosion</description>

    <item> 
      <title>What is the most expensive object on Earth?</title>  
      <description>Will a new UK nuclear power station be the most expensive thing ever built?</description>
